WRITING.TITLE: FODDER banned on CEVO for another 2 years.

WRITING.TEXT: He just got overwatch banned.
Funny thing is, a month or two ago everyone was praising S1mple. Now everyone is back on the hate train.

Liquid told him he could play whatever role he wanted, then they picked up Koosta who can't rifle so S1mple had to.
Kid was just homesick, he wanted to see his family, friends and gf. He lived all alone in LA, while his teammates were home and they could visit their friends/family all they want.
Then Liquid promised a bootcamp which never came either.
It sucks for s1mple as well, but there's two sides to every story. We'll just have to wait for Liquid's statement or what the players say down the line.
I love s1mple as a player, but there's no doubt he has a very strong personality.
Like Hiko said yesterday, his play style usually wins or loses them rounds. At MLG it won them over 50% of rounds.
Dropping HR's best player wouldn't be a good idea and s1mple isn't a huge upgrade.

According to Hiko, Liquid is trying to get him into a European team most likely without a big buyout.
However, the only team I feel like he would maybe fit in is Faze. Na'Vi is the 2nd best team in the world, so for them to do a roster change now would be idiotic.
He left F3 with bad blood between him and the players, Oskar from HR definitely doesn't want him either. Gambit could be an option, but I'm not sure how those players feel about s1mple either.
This is his real twitter: https://twitter.com/s1mpleO

Great video although it's a bit long. Watched all of it though since I'm definitely going to buy Overwatch and I haven't seen all that much of the game.
Also, it's great to see you and AZK get into this game and staying relevant in competitive gaming.
It was a big part of why he was kicked. They also didn't give adreN a chance to prove himself with a different role, they put Hiko/Nitr0 on the IGL role after he was kicked, which was a mistake imo.
Yep, was just a great support player.
He still had a decent showing and you can't say that just him choked. After half time Hiko got a total of 3 kills, that's choking hard.
Actually adreN still played well after the group stage. The only map he did bad on was against Luminosity on Mirage. Other than that, he had an amazing tournament.
No, he got kicked because him and s1mple didn't get along. Go watch Hiko's interview with Launders.
Only person who comes to my mind is Cutler.
Never said he wasn't, I just said he was banned. I'm aware about him being part of Liquid's Overwatch team and I'm very happy they're willing to give him a 2nd chance in competitive gaming.
JDM would get the AWP no matter what, he is their star player. Liquid should just stop trying to please s1mple and play to win.
Even main awpers need to be able to use a rifle, getting 4 kills a half without having awp still doesn't cut it.

Nitr0 played like a mad man. It seemed like Liquid just overextended way too much, especially s1mple (probably due to tilting). I mean hell, the guy has insane talent, but he needs to learn to stop overextending and to play smart. Also to just calm down.
Koosta played like dogshit on T-side because he can't do shit with a rifle, s1mple was pretty quiet with it too so I don't see why they didnt just let Koosta have it.

Exactly. They have 3 aggresive players, a lurk and koosta as support I guess? They just need a rock, a rifler who can keep sites on lockdown until teammates rotate. Like Krimz, xyp9x etc. Sadly there aren't a lot of good support players in America, and one of the best ones is banned, AZK.
adreN basically got kicked because of him, now Koosta performs like shit while adreN did great during the major.
adreN is still under contract with Liquid.
adreN was the problem EleGiggle
